book
Class ProductBook

java.lang.Object
  book.ProductBook

public class ProductBook
extends java.lang.Object

The ProductBook object maintains the Buy and Sell sides of a stock’s “book”.

Author:
Urvi

Method Detail

getOrdersWithRemainingQty

public java.util.ArrayList<TradableDTO> getOrdersWithRemainingQty(java.lang.String username)
                                                           throws InvalidArgumentException
Gets an ArrayList of TradableDTO’s containing information on all the orders in this ProductBookSide that have remaining quantity for the specified user. This is done via ProductBookSide.getOrdersWithRemainingQty(String).

Throws:
InvalidArgumentException - if username is null or empty
See Also:
ProductBookSide.getOrdersWithRemainingQty(String)

checkTooLateToCancel

public void checkTooLateToCancel(java.lang.String orderId)
                          throws OrderNotFoundException,
                                 InvalidArgumentException,
                                 InvalidVolumeValueException
Determine if it is too late to cancel an order (meaning it has already been traded out or cancelled), then creates a CancelMessage to be published

Parameters:
orderId - Id for order that may have been traded or cancelled
Throws:
OrderNotFoundException - if Order with orderId is not found
InvalidArgumentException
InvalidVolumeValueException - if orderId is null or empty
See Also:
CancelMessage.CancelMessage(String, String, Price, int, String, Tradable.Side, String)

getBookDepth

public java.lang.String[][] getBookDepth()
Get the book depth via a call to ProductBookSide.getBookDepth()

See Also:
ProductBookSide.getBookDepth()

getMarketData

public MarketDataDTO getMarketData()
Create a MarketDataDTO containing the best buy side price and volume

Returns:
TradableDTO object that contains the best buy/sell prices and volumes
See Also:
ProductBookSide.topOfBookPrice(), ProductBookSide.topOfBookVolume()

                 throws InvalidVolumeValueException,

Parameters:

Throws:
InvalidVolumeValueException
InvalidArgumentException - if t is null

openMarket

public void openMarket()
                throws InvalidVolumeValueException,
                       InvalidArgumentException
Opens the book for trading. Any resting Order and QuoteSides that are immediately tradable upon opening should be traded.

Throws:
InvalidVolumeValueException
InvalidArgumentException
See Also:
tryTrade(Tradable, ProductBookSide.BookSide)

closeMarket

public void closeMarket()
                 throws InvalidArgumentException,
                        InvalidVolumeValueException,
                        OrderNotFoundException
Cancels Orders and QuoteSides for BUY and SELL sides of the ProductBook upon market close. This is done via ProuctBookSide.cancelAll().

Throws:
InvalidArgumentException
InvalidVolumeValueException
OrderNotFoundException
See Also:
ProductBookSide.cancelAll()

cancelOrder

public void cancelOrder(ProductBookSide.BookSide side,
                        java.lang.String orderId)
                 throws InvalidArgumentException,
                        InvalidVolumeValueException,
                        OrderNotFoundException
Cancels an Order for given side of the book. This is done via a call to ProductBookSide.cancelOrder(String). This method takes a String which is the user name on the Order to be cancelled.

Throws:
InvalidArgumentException
InvalidVolumeValueException
OrderNotFoundException
See Also:
ProductBookSide.submitOrderCancel(String)

cancelQuote

public void cancelQuote(java.lang.String username)
                 throws InvalidArgumentException,
                        InvalidVolumeValueException

Throws:
InvalidArgumentException
InvalidVolumeValueException
See Also:
ProductBookSide.submitQuoteCancel(String)

addToBook

public void addToBook(Quote q)
               throws DataValidationException,
                      InvalidVolumeValueException,
                      InvalidArgumentException
Adds the provided Quote’s sides to the Buy and Sell ProductSideBooks.

Parameters:
q - Quote to be added to the book
Throws:
DataValidationException - if sell price of QuoteSide is less than buy price of QuoteSide or if sell or buy price of QuoteSide is zero
InvalidVolumeValueException
InvalidArgumentException
See Also:
ProductBookSide.removeQuote(String), addToBook(Tradable.Side, Tradable)

addToBook

public void addToBook(Order o)
               throws InvalidArgumentException,
                      InvalidVolumeValueException
Method adds the provided Order to the appropriate ProductSideBook

Parameters:
o - Order object be added
Throws:
InvalidArgumentException - if o is null
InvalidVolumeValueException
See Also:
addToBook(Tradable.Side, Tradable), updateCurrentMarket()

updateCurrentMarket

public void updateCurrentMarket()
                         throws InvalidArgumentException
Determines if the market for a stock product has been updated. Once a change has been detected, a MarketDataDTO object is created and a CurrentMarket message is published.

Throws:
InvalidArgumentException
See Also:
CurrentMarketPublisher.publishCurrentMarket(MarketDataDTO)

getEntriesAtTopOfBook

public java.util.ArrayList<Tradable> getEntriesAtTopOfBook(Tradable trd)
                                                    throws InvalidArgumentException
Returns an ArrayList of the Tradables that are at the best price. This is done via a call to ProductBookSide.getEntriesAtTopOfBook()

Parameters:
trd - The Tradable for which to get the entries, used to determine which ProductBookSide (BUY or SELL) is to be used
Returns:
ArrayList of the Tradables that are at the best price
Throws:
InvalidArgumentException - if trd is null

clearIfEmpty

public void clearIfEmpty(Tradable trd)
                  throws InvalidArgumentException
Clears the appropriate side of the book (BUY or SELL). This is done via a call to ProductBookSide.clearIfEmpty(Price).

Parameters:
trd - Tradable from which to determine which ProductBookSide (BUY or SELL) clear and from which to determine the Price associated with the ArrayList to be removed
Throws:
InvalidArgumentException - if trd is null
See Also:
ProductBookSide.clearIfEmpty(Price)

topOfBookPrice

public Price topOfBookPrice(Tradable trd)
                     throws InvalidArgumentException
Determines the best Price for a BookSide (BUY or SELL) for the Tradable. This is done via a call to ProductBookSide.topOfBookPrice()

Throws:
InvalidArgumentException - if trd is null
See Also:
ProductBookSide.topOfBookPrice()

tryTrade

public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,FillMessage> tryTrade(Tradable t,
                                                                ProductBookSide.BookSide s)
                                                         throws InvalidVolumeValueException,
                                                                InvalidArgumentException
Tries a trade of the provided Tradable against entries in this ProductBookSide.

Parameters:
t - Tradable to be traded
s - Side of the tradable to be traded
Returns:
HashMap of FillMessages
Throws:
InvalidVolumeValueException
InvalidArgumentException - if t or s are null
See Also:
ProductBookSide.tryTrade(Tradable)
